Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100 and (b) no member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, as determined by NASA data. (2) None of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 (b) There be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if either of the following is true: 
1. One of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.
   - Eric Trump
   - Ivanka Trump
   - Tiffany Trump
   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump
2. By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalized relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data.

Resolution Criteria

This resolves negatively by any other outcome.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100 (b) Neither of the following occurs: (i) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 (ii) Stacey Abrams is elected president in or before the 2040 election?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met:
1. By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, according to NASA data, with a critical value of 1.8 ˚C based on the 1951-1980 baseline.
2. Neither of the following occurs: (i) None of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump; (ii) Stacey Abrams is not elected president in or before 2040 or the result is overturned prior to inauguration.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? (b) Stacey Abrams be elected president in or before the 2040 election? Or will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This resolves positively if any of the following occurs:
1. One of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.
2. Stacey Abrams is elected president in or before 2040 and the result is not overturned prior to inauguration, whether or not she is actually inaugurated.
3. By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The human condition change fundamentally before January 1, 2100? (b) Neither of the following occur: (i) At least one member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024; (ii) There be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
1. The question regarding the human condition will resolve positively if, before January 1, 2100, the human condition changes fundamentally to at least roughly the same extent that it did after the agricultural and industrial revolutions, as defined by the general level of social complexity, economic productivity, and ability to manipulate physical reality humanity has achieved at the civilizational level. This will be determined by community and Metaculus predictions meeting certain thresholds after January 1, 2025, or by a committee of Metaculus admins if needed.

2. The question regarding the Trump family and global warming will resolve positively if neither of the following is true: (i) At least one member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, or (ii) There has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years by January 1, 2100, in which the average global temperature was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.

question.title: If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected but the upper tax bracket is not increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No.
If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous

question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC.
